title: Task 94

question.text: Why is the verb know used as knows after everyone?

answers.feedback: Everyone sounds plural but grammatically functions as a singular noun.

answers.answer: Because the subject of the sentence is plural.
answers.feedback: Even though team members is plural, everyone is the subject here.

answers.answer: Because it is referring to team members in the past tense.
answers.feedback: The tense of the verb is present, not past, as indicated by the context of the sentence.

dialogue.text: All the team members have a chance to speak, so everyone knows what the others are doing.

description:
In English, the verb know is conjugated to knows when the subject is singular and in third person.

Everyone refers to a group but it is treated as a singular noun, thatâ€™s why in English the correct form is everyone knows.
